data.text:
Overview About Universiti Tun Hussein Onn Malaysia (UTHM)

UTHM, also known as Universiti Tun Hussein Onn Malaysia, is a prestigious public university located in the lively town of Batu Pahat, Johor, Malaysia. Since its establishment in 1993, the university has gained recognition for its unwavering commitment to delivering excellent education and promoting innovation in engineering and technology.

UTHM takes pride in nurturing graduates who possess exceptional technical expertise and uphold strong ethical values. By doing so, they actively contribute to the nation's progress and tackle the ever-evolving challenges of the global arena.

Spanning across 1,000 acres, UTHM's campus provides a favorable atmosphere for academic pursuits and extracurricular involvement. The university prides itself on its diverse student community, which comprises both local and international students who can take advantage of the various undergraduate and postgraduate programs offered.

Faculties

Step into UTHM and discover a world of possibilities across its numerous faculties. Whether you're interested in Engineering Technology, Technical and Vocational Education, Science and Mathematics, Computing, or Technology Management and Technopreneurship, UTHM has got you covered. With a curriculum designed to meet the needs of various industries, UTHM ensures that its graduates are ready to make their mark in the professional world.

UTHM prioritizes research and development, showcasing its commitment through the establishment of specialized research centers and institutes. Notable examples include the Sustainable Infrastructure Engineering Research Center and the Advanced Materials and Structural Testing Center. The campus boasts state-of-the-art facilities, encompassing well-equipped laboratories, lecture halls, libraries, and recreational areas.

UTHM Programmes & Courses

The university provides an extensive selection of diploma, undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs, presenting students with a wide array of prospects for professional growth and continued learning.

Undergraduate degrees

Engineering Technology Programs (3-4 years)

Technical and Vocational Education Programs (3-4 years)

Science and Mathematics Programs (3-4 years)

Computing Programs (3-4 years)

Technology Management and Technopreneurship Programs (3-4 years)

Postgraduate degrees

Doctor of Philosophy in Engineering (3-4 years)

Master of Engineering (1-2 years)

Master of Science in Technical and Vocational Education (1-2 years)

Master of Technology Management (1-2 years)

Studying Cost in Malaysia

UTHM offers a range of tuition fees depending on the level of study, program, and duration. Local students can expect to pay an estimated annual tuition fee of USD 8,000 to USD 20,000 for undergraduate programs and USD 15,000 to USD 30,000 for postgraduate programs. International students, on the other hand, may have higher tuition fees ranging from USD 12,000 to USD 35,000 for undergraduate programs and USD 18,000 to USD 40,000 for postgraduate programs.

Students should take into account more than just tuition fees when budgeting for their education. They should also factor in expenses like housing, food, transportation, and healthcare. Fortunately, the cost of living in Batu Pahat is quite reasonable, with average monthly accommodation costs ranging from USD 100 to USD 200 and other living expenses ranging from USD 150 to USD 300.

Admission Requirement

To be considered for admission, potential students must meet certain eligibility requirements. These requirements include completing the necessary pre-university coursework, holding relevant qualifications, and satisfying English language proficiency standards. For international applicants, proficiency can be demonstrated through standardized tests like TOEFL or IELTS.

International Students Facilities

UTHM provides comprehensive support services to international students through its International Office. The office serves as a centralized hub for information on academics, accommodation, visas, and other related matters. The university offers facilities such as prayer rooms, halal food options, health services, and counseling services to meet the diverse needs of its international student community.

Accommodation

UTHM provides various on-campus housing choices for both domestic and international students. The university's dormitory-style residences are equipped with essential facilities such as beds, study tables, chairs, and wardrobes. The monthly cost of on-campus accommodation varies between USD 80 and USD 180, depending on the duration of stay and the type of room selected.

Several housing options are readily accessible for students who favor off-campus living, encompassing apartments and rental homes. The expenses associated with off-campus accommodation differ depending on various factors, including location, size, and available facilities.

Universiti Tun Hussein Onn Malaysia Ranking

UTHM has established itself as a reputable institution, contributing to the educational landscape in Malaysia and beyond. While specific rankings may vary, UTHM consistently maintains a strong position among Malaysian universities. #1001 QS World University Rankings for the most recent information on UTHM's global standing.

Address Persiaran Tun Dr. Ismail, 86400 Parit Raja, Johor, Malaysia

Why Choose Universiti Malaysia Terengganu (UMT)

Marine Expertise: UMT is renowned for its exceptional marine and oceanography studies, making it an optimal choice for individuals interested in these fields.

Location Advantage: Situated in Terengganu, UMT offers close proximity to a wide range of marine ecosystems, enriching practical learning experiences and research prospects.

Research Excellence: UMT is dedicated to pioneering research, providing students with valuable opportunities to participate in impactful projects within the marine and environmental sciences.

Cutting-Edge Facilities: The university prides itself on its state-of-the-art facilities and laboratories, ensuring that students have access to resources that enhance their academic journey.

Distinctive Academic Programs: UMT stands out with its specialized programs in marine and aquatic sciences, equipping students with unique expertise in their chosen field.

Global Collaboration: Through international collaborations, UMT exposes students to diverse perspectives and offers them opportunities for international experiences.

Cultural Diversity: Malaysia's multicultural environment creates a welcoming atmosphere for international students, fostering a culturally enriching experience.

Career Prospects: UMT graduates, particularly in marine sciences, are well-prepared for careers in research, environmental organizations, government agencies, and related industries.
